title: Does compare mean similarities and differences? - Quora

response.answer_text: Whenever you have an essay question that asks you to compare it is a good idea to insert the words “and contrast" into your brain as you start on the task. The reason for this is that is that if you only compare the similarities between things the reader (examiner) will not know if you can fully differentiate between them. A question that only wants similarities will make that clear.
Often questions ask the student to compare and contrast. Compare is to point out the similarities in form or function. This is a favourite question in biology.
